snippet.title: 'Nothing like this has ever happened before': Cologne cable car accident traps 65
snippet.content:
Emergency services stage dramatic rescue of people trapped in cable car over Rhine 1:18
Rescue workers stage a dramatic operation to bring more than 100 cable car passengers to safety after they were stranded by an accident over the Rhine river in Cologne, Germany.
July 31st 2017 8 hours ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Network News/National/
A gondola of the Cologne cable car, which crosses the Rhine, wedged itself on a ropeway support.
Staff writerNews Corp Australia Network
Share
EMERGENCY services have dramatically rescued 65 people who were stranded in midair after a collision on a cable car line high above the Rhine river in Cologne. The line was immobilised "for hours", rescuers said, and passengers were stuck in their cable cars. Twenty children were among those stranded. Dramatic footage and photos show workers had to abseil passengers onto a fire department boat on the river.
A father and his child are abseiled from a gondola over the Rhine in Cologne, western Germany.Source:AFP
In terrifying scenes, a gondola of the Cologne cable car, which crosses the Rhine, wedged itself on a ropeway support.Source:AFP Other passengers clambered to safety on the shore or a major bridge from fire truck ladders. There were no injuries. The last person was rescued some five hours after the collision on the line. Emergency crews from surrounding towns were called in to help. More than 100 people were involved in the rescue effort.
Members of the fire service rescued people from the cable cars.Source:AP
Bystanders were shocked by the dramatic accident.Source:AP "Nothing like this has ever happened before," said fire department spokesman Christian Heinisch. Cologne authorities provided counselling for those people who had been stranded and were rescued.
